all_reviews.review_title: A strong and data-rich ABM Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
RollWorks is a strong and effective ABM tool for our team. The ability to narrowly or broadly track intent signals, traffic, and list progression is a huge benefit to our business. It integrates with HubSpot so we can programmatically notify our business development team about spiking accounts, and we can sync HubSpot-defined lists to RollWorks in order to populate campaign lists, determine ICP, and more.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I think you get out of RollWorks what you put into it - and that goes for any product. If you don't have clearly defined goals or a clear understanding of how you want to run ABM, it's going to be less useful. If you know what you want and what kind of messages will resonate with your accounts or verticals, you're good to go. If I have to come up with something here, maybe that the ad image directory can feel unweildly if you have a lot of creative.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
RollWorks is giving our team visibility into overall levels of account intent by aggregating data from multiple sources, including G2, native web tracking tools, their own intent data, and (of course) Bombora. It is making those intent signals and spikes available to our sales team and useful in a programmatic way that makes outreach to accounts much more efficient. We have the ability with RollWorks to granularly target accounts with hyper-relevant messaging, and reliably reach users inside of those accounts to increase awareness. We also have the ability to tailor messaging based on the level of engagement they've shown.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Director of Demand Generation and Digital Marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Great UI. Have seen significant growth since we have started using.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The UI is probably the best part about the platform. From uploading your ads to looking at the data at a glance, it is very easy to do so quickly. The industry comparison report is a nice directional report as well.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I still have questions on the audiences and the specific targeting that they use. Also, I wish I had more control over the specific bids that they use for each tactic.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is a great platform for small business and small marketing teams like us. There are 3 problems that is has solved:

Improving conversion rates: Showing targeted ads to the right people at the right time has helped us improve our conversion rates.

Measuring and optimizing performance: They have provided detailed performance reporting and analytics that allow us to track ad campaign performance and make data-driven decisions to optimize our campaigns for better results.

Scaling advertising efforts: They offer an easy-to-use platform that makes it simple for us to scale our advertising efforts, even with limited resources and technical expertise.

all_reviews.review_title: Best value for money ABM platform for medium to large businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
It has all the features and capabilities you need to start deploying ABM on a larger scale. It has both Bombora and its own intent data, a simple but effective reporting system, several ways to segment website visitors, and you can find accounts to target directly on it. Hence, there's no need to pay extra for data. It sends a decent amount of helpful data to Hubspot and Salesforce, allowing you to orchestrate from your marketing automation platform. As for advertising, it's Adroll, so it's one of the best platforms out there.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The intent keywords feature is new and not very convenient to use - you can't group keywords, and it's hard to report on the effectiveness of keywords as a whole. Also, they can't automatically push accounts you find to the CRM, which requires manual work for setting up the campaigns.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows us to understand which ICP is right for us - we can test similar messaging on different ICPs and then see which ICP responds better to our offerings. We can then also retroactively look at their intent data and try to find correlations.

all_reviews.review_title: Streamlined way to account for quality over quantity when it comes to awareness and conversion
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Obviously leveraging the platform is beneficial, but sometimes simply signing on with platforms like this are essentially for really thinking through processes and how to best target the folks you need. It's really helped with data integrity on our end, and forced us to evaluate the best direction of spend. That said, it does also ensure we can target the right people at the right time with the right ads.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
We've had a few technical challenges setting things up - because our systems were not designed specifically the way Rollworks reads them, we were not as prepared for the integration as we could have been had someone alerted us earlier into how all the matching, etc. worked. Additionally, we still have a lot of work to do to ensure our ads match the Rollworks recommended criteria, so the more handholding up front, the better. If we succeed, we remain a customer!

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Prior to RollWorks, we were just throwing the ads out there and seeing what sticks. While we could do some direct targeting on platforms, they're based on self selected criteria, and not based on actual patterns of engagement or knowledge garnered from thousands of proof-points which RollWorks provides.

We have been using the platform a little lesst han a year now and have the most positive experience. Our account manager Selin is the best, very knowledgeable and happy to help. It has been a pleasure working with the company.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Requires an extensive configuration and onboarding due to the nature of customization and the specific use for every business. I wish the onboarding and configuration phase was faster so that we could start recouping ROI faster. YOu also need a dedicated person to handle the platform to make the best use of it in my opinion.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful and easy-to-use platform for account-based marketing and retargeting
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Easy-to-use platform for account-based marketing and broader retargeting. The platform makes it easy for us to reach the right people at the right accounts and leverage intent data and engagement to help prioritize which to focus on.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Limited reach to accounts that are only in our database/crm (Salesforce). Would love to have an easy way without manual lists, etc. to identify and target new accounts.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Targeting and reaching our key accounts and high-value audiences to retarget. It's very helpful in allowing us to reach the right people at the right time with messages and offers relevant to them.

all_reviews.review_title: Easiest and most effective way to run an in-house digital marketing strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The connection to Hubspot is best in class. The ability to take our database, enrich it with Rollworks intent data and then target our leads across the internet allows us to scale our small sales team and create an engaged and qualified pipeline for our sales team to convert.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
There isn't anything we don't like about the platform. There are some features that are available to salesforce customers but not hubspot so that is sometimes annoying.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a small sales team so it functions as our BDM "cold calling" the potential leads showing intent across the internet and driving leads back to our properties to fill out demo requests, etc so that our sales team is focused on engaged, qualified leads.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
It'd be great if Rollworks added the functionality to exclude specific websites e.g. Around 15% of our impressions are coming from the same site and it's just a generic news site that we'd prefer to exclude. Some of the reporting is a bit buggy also e.g. the visitor deanonymisation isn't currently working.

all_reviews.review_title: Rollworks Review after about a year and a half of utilization.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks does ABM really well, and has a very easy process to rolling out your advertisments. You can also operate on a contact list level and go after very specific pre-existing leads. So in terms of an account-based strategy, Rollworks gets the job done.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks needs to be better at deanonimizing contacts that are not currently in your CRM and the way they calculate ROI will not make sense to organizations that talk only in "lead" terms.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a very good idea of who we want to be targeting, so this definitely helps with staying on the radar of the organizations that interest us. We also like to use intent words to see competitor trends/interests at those accounts.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive ABM Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
RollWorks makes uploading ads, creating campaigns & playbooks and refining targeting easy. I appreciate that the platform is intuitive and campaign performance/account progression is easy to track and evaluate. The Hubspot integration works very well. It's a great ABM platform for lean and mean startups!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Sometimes the reporting could be more detailed and/or clear. I.e. - I'd love more information on which ads target accounts are engaging with vs. general ad performance (this can be due to the advertising channel). I've also seen the reports refelct past data from accounts that may not be related to the particular campaign.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks enables us to advertise to a very focused audience rather than casting such a wide net, and the intent signals are helpful in bringing marketing and sales efforts full circle.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Ease of use to get campaigns up and running, the onboarding team was very helpful as well.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The micro level and granular details to optimize campaigns and playbooks aren't explained too well - a lot of trial and error has gone into our campaigns coming out with the desired CTR.

all_reviews.review_title: Account-Based Display, Valuable Account-Specific Insights
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Aside from our account team, who supports us tremendously, the account-based insights and reporting are valuable for showcasing our display efforts' value. Due to our connections with our Salesforce instance, we can track ad exposures and engagement against funnel metrics like sales meetings set, opportunity creation and closed/won revenue. This allows us to tell rich account-based stories and assert our ability to influence deals. We are able use 6Sense segments and supplement them with additional intent data to ensure our ad spend is focused on the right audiences. Their product roadmap is also very promising, with many new features, reporting capabilities and integrations coming soon.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Honestly, there isn't much that I dislike about this platform. The user interface is very intuitive, our account team always helps us execute large campaign changes (like net-new campaigns, brand refreshes, etc.), the product feature rollouts have been communicated very well, and we've seen some promising results from our campaigns. Our experience has been pretty smooth so far!

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We leverage Rollworks to reach accounts across various segments (CML, ENT, STR and Pub Sec) to drive awareness and website traffic and nurture accounts through the sales funnel. Our ability to reach specific accounts that the sales team wants to win helps us to eliminate media waste while keeping our company top-of-mind in the marketplace for our prospects. It is also our primary source for account-based marketing reporting for our paid media team for account reach, account engagement, account progression, influence opportunities, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid ABM platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Not having to launch campaigns natively (in LI or FB) is a feature that's a must for me. RollWorks was the first ABM platform I used that could do this and now it's crucial to my day-to-day. One small thing I like is being able to add accounts to an active target account list. I've used other platforms that make you reupload the list and that can be a huge pain.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Having used other ABM platforms, I've found that Rollworks can get the job done, but the audience targeting capabilities aren't as good as others. And there's a lack of campaign/ad experimentation.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
I had a client that pivoted their entire paid media strategy to ABM. Rollworks onboarding process was easy, simple, and I found the tool to be very intuitive. We also were able to run display and paid social campaigns all in one platform. This saved time and made reporting on target account metrics much easier.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks powers our ABM strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Right from onboarding to account CSMs, we got a chance to work with an agile team like ours, a team that works at our pace.

RollWorks ABM Platform helps
- Target the specific accounts to pursue - Trending, High Intent, and Accounts that are not in the CRM
- The platform is fairly easy to use and kickstart. Our onboarding and account setup was done within 2 weeks.
- Provide account engagements insights and an easy way to export these accounts into lists
- Easy to add/update journey stages
- Empower Account-based marketing and directly enroll them into tools such as Outreach or such tools for the Sales team to pick up.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
- Net new accounts targeted, and engaged every month is not very clear.
- A full Journey Stage progression report of all target Account Lists would be helpful.
- Sometimes platform throws errors without stating what the error is.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. RollWorks is helping us target the right accounts with the right messaging at different stages of their buying journey and at the right time on their preferred channels.
2. We've got better at attributing the retargeted users and where they came from.

all_reviews.review_title: A good tool to manage Advertisements
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
1- It automates the process of placing ads
2- allows you to control the budget spending
3- integrates with hubspot and salesforce and allows market segmentation through them (or creating the lists inside Rollworks but you don't want to do that)
4- Gives a simple adequate Ads building tool

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
1- You cannot target specific people; you need to target a whole company domain  (this could be multiple times more expensive)
2- You may need an external ad-building tool to have more sophisticated ads
3- The future of the product is not declared, as, in 2024, the whole market is changing with regulations about cookies.
4- Excluding Google and making Linkedin outside the main package, you lose a lot of business-related ads channels or you would have to add budget for those

all_reviews.review_title: Great Self Service ABM platform for companies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
This is a great platform to use if you want to get into ABM but don't have the budget or resources to hire an outbound SDR or ABM company.  It has much more data and segmentation than Zoom Info and Lusha and you can build audiences very easily and find the key stakeholders.  I like that I can then set the strategy and content and roll out as I need or want to.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The targeting is strong but when you start buying some of the media/display advertising it isn't as good as being site specific.  I cannot prove it but I feel like this leads to waste in the spend and time since we may be advertising on sites or areas that are not a good fit or have really small display specs.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
As marketing budgets get smaller we need every dollar to work harder for us.  We needed to break into ABM marketing so that we could be more targeted and drive higher conversion rates then we are getting from our generic full funnel campaign running on the normal channels.   By being more targeted we hope to close our budget gap.

all_reviews.review_title: An Intuitive Tool To Effectively Reach Your Audience At Scale
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Targeting Capabilities: RollWorks offers advanced targeting capabilities that enable our business to reach our desired audience. Able to target our campaigns based on factors such as location, demographics, device, interests, behaviors, etc.

Advanced Analytics: RollWorks provides has a robust analytics dashboard that offers insights into the performance of our campaigns. This includes all the basics (impressions, clicks, conversions, and return on ad spend), and it can all be easily exported to help optimize campaigns and measure success

Cross-device Capabilities: RollWorks supports cross-device advertising, meaning that businesses can reach their target audience across multiple devices, including desktops, mobile phones, and tablets. This is especially useful for businesses targeting mobile-first audiences, as it allows them to reach their audience wherever they are.

Custom Audiences: Can create targeting cohorts based on website visitors, email subscribers, and customer lists

Most of all, and unlike some other platforms, the experience is user-friendly with an intuitive interface.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
While the platform is user-friendly, it still requires a certain level of technical expertise and knowledge to use effectively.

RollWorks also offers limited control over the creative aspects of advertising campaigns, such as ad format and design, so you need to play within the creative confines of available formats.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks is another tool in our advertising toolbox to drive cost-effective ad impressions and get in front of our audience to reinforce our brand. It's a nice compliment to some of the other platforms we are using.

I appreciate the intent data and have given access to Rollworks analytics to our sales team, who have successfully reached out to companies that are showing intent.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
review_question_answers.answer: I can't think of anything I don't like.  The product stays current and the team is easy to work with.  I also like that RollWorks is so popular that it is easy to find people to work within the platform.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: RollWorks is helping us create sales pipeline that closes.    We can test what messages and content perform best and double down on those messages and content in other ways.  Bottom line comes down to sourcing and influencing sales.

all_reviews.review_title: By Far the Best ABM Advertising Platform!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks is by far the most user-friendly yet advanced ABM advertising platform. It makes it so easy to target accounts & contact lists with significant efficiency. I love the analytics and reports that Rollworks gives you based on all campaigns and how accounts are engaging. The n digging deeper into account insights to see the customer journey, their intent data, and other contributing engagement metrics that could help us more easily identify the account we need to target. Their new Linkedin sync feature is incredible and has helped us decrease of CPL by 25x. It's a phenomenal platform and would highly recommend it to anyone!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I would love it if they showed analytics on the Linkedin campaigns from the synced audiences. Also, would be great if the account scoring model was points based for different engagement metrics and could be set at a very custom level. But other than that everything else is great!

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing all our retargeting in one platform. Helping our SDRs identify engaged accounts. Running air coverage for ABM campaigns. Building out contact list targeting campaigns etc. So many problems were solved!

all_reviews.review_title: Top ABM Platform for mid-size companies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Adding RollWorks to our Marketing tech stack improved the effectiveness of our marketing team and presented a great opportunity for team members to work with a modern, AI-based tool.
Its bidirectional sync with Salesforce has reduced time to action by speeding up the workflows and reducing manual steps to upload and update data related to target accounts. Using this data, our SEO experts can directly target known and unknown contacts with digital ads.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Building reports on account-level engagement is a challenge. We usually had to download data from the platform and work with the data from .csv exports to create reports.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks helped us identify target accounts based on their purchase intent and then helped our SEO experts run effective ad campaigns against these target accounts.

This gives us more targeting to put personalized ads in front of specific accounts. We're hoping this will increase conversions, but it's had limitations so far. Every account has a minimum of 100 contacts to be targeted, which has proven to be difficult for our industry.

all_reviews.review_title: Have had positive experiences in the past- but wow, things have gone downhill
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Previously I would have said everything, from onboarding to support, working with Rollworks years ago felt like having another team member. Everything was thoroughly explained and planned out.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Nothing is the same. Onboarding was non-existent. When it was time to launch, we were suddenly unable to do anything we'd previously discussed during the sales cycle and onboarding. From there, problem after problem began to arise- from being unable to conduct the basic testing we wanted, to being unable to isolate and serve ads to our core personas, we had so many unresolved issues that never got fixed. We never generated a single lead. But- that's also hard to say since they also were never able to figure out basic conversion tracking for us.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were trying to run a very basic account-based advertising strategy. Nothing complex. Just simply trying to serve the right ad to the right people at the right time- something we were promised we could do over and over by this team. We never got anything useful stood up. We were sent in circles and left to figure things out on our own with zero apologies. Most expensive mistake of my life.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks has up-leveled our entire digital strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The UX is intuitive & straightforward compared to a lot of other AMB Display tools. The integrations with our CRM & other ad platforms (ex/ LinkedIn) have allowed us to build-out Audience Lists for use across all of our paid channels, not just Display. Lastly, our CSM team is extremely proactive & helpful, coming to each discussion with good analysis, recommendations, and best practices for all of our display initiatives!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
There is not much to dislike. RollWorks offers many tools for sales enablement & account monitoring, but our team is not yet at a place where we can utilize them. However, once we strengthen our Sales enablement processes and have more of an opportunity to test these out, I'm sure they would be incredibly useful for our team.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a strict ICP and Target Acct List, so expanding outside of our TAL while staying within our ICP can be a challenge.  RollWorks has enabled us to identify more ideal in-market accounts to target across our campaigns based on account firmographics, website & ad engagement, and third-party intent signals.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks Has a Great Onboarding Process and It's Powering Our ABM Strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Support has been great from the initial stages of vetting the product, all the way through where we are at now, 2 months after our playbooks went live. We've been passed from team to team as we've moved through the setup phases and I'd say it's gone pretty seamlessly. There has been a lot for us to learn, but they take intentional steps to ensure that we feel comfortable with the tool and have all the resources we need. I like that they have tailored our playbooks to fit our level of experience and our goals - so really anyone from beginner level to expert level could use the product.

Lastly, I just attended a product update webinar and RollWorks has some major updates and integrations on the horizon, so I like that they are evolving and improving consistently.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
We haven't seen great engagement rates with our ads yet, but we just launched our first round, and the customer success team has been very good at bringing this to our attention rather than hiding being other success metrics. They provide benchmarks that they would like for our playbooks to hit and then suggest ways for us to optimize.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are retargeting site visitors and engaging prospects that align with our outbound sales campaign. We are also leveraging the platform for its intent data to equip our sales team.

all_reviews.review_title: Sophisticated platform with native SF integration that makes for high quality and effective ABM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The salesforce integration is key  - giving the ability to sync over high intent users either dynamically or via a list upload. This really helps us develop stronger, more effective ABM strategies. Another huge, perhaps main, upside is the the account representatives, specifically a senior strategic customer success manager that is on our account. She is well versed on our account, our strategy, our targets and is so thorough and detail oriented, and never lets anything slip through the cracks, which can be very easy given how large our program is. All of which makes a HUGE difference in what we do and how well we are able to do it. Really appreciate the partnership with her on driving the most efficient outcomes with our ABM strategy and execution. Thank you to Jennifer George.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The platform has a few limitations, namely when it comes to reporting. The lack of geo-level reporting is a tough limitation in general as well as the ability to manage / make tweaks to campaigns (i.e. enable / pause / budget adjustment) - these are things that take some back and forth, especially with a program of our scale. The ability to co-manage that alongside our excellent RW team would be wonderful.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching our customers and prospects, and specifically segmenting them by either product purchased or company size or title - these are things that are hugely beneficial to us as we need that level of granularity in order to have a good ABM program.

RollWorks has an easy-to-use platform that has entirely changed how we run ad campaigns! My favorite features are how journey stages are tracked and the ability to track it all seamlessly in HubSpot. We also love working with our account rep, Corrin Doherty. Playbooks inside the platform take a bit to configure, but they are also valuable tools that help us tremendously.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
There isn't much we don't care for or dislike within RollWorks, but I will say that setting up the ads inside takes a bit of time. It's essential to have a dedicated resource, either at RollWorks or internally, to set up, create, and manage these campaigns.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
RollWorks has made it so we can get customized advertising and messaging out to specific audiences through not only our own ABM lists but the matching features that we utilize as well. Seeing the activity of specific ABM targets within the platform and HubSpot has also helped improve internal communications.

all_reviews.review_title: Fails to Deliver Leads and Can't Explain Reporting Discrepancies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I love the ability to target advertising to specific roles, at specific accounts, that show specific intent. I also love the ability to target ads based on journey stage. Our target audience is US hospitals with a few additional parameters, so our account targets are very precise. An ABM platform is the best way for us to reach that audience. I've onboarded RollWorks twice, and the onboarding teams have both been great at getting us up and running. The integration with HubSpot is fantastic - I have HubSpot set up in a way that allows my sales team to identify their target accounts and have control over who gets our ads. We're also sync RollWorks intent data with HubSpot to help us qualify our leads.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
For us, RollWorks has absolutely failed to deliver leads. Of all of the platforms we use for lead generation, Rollworks is in last place. In 8 months, RollWorks hasn't generated a single download of a piece of content from our website (we're only asking for an email in return.) There is no evidence that ads have contributed to a lead becoming an SQL, or to an SQL converting to an Opportunity. I've used the intent data alone to tip off the sales team to potential opportunities within specific accounts, and that's never resulted in any kind of conversation either.

I have a dedicated resource that spends 40 hours a month managing our RollWorks programs. We've built campaigns at every stage of the funnel, for multiple products, and have tested targeting ads both with and without intent. It's conservative to say we've tested a broad range of ads, messages and types of campaigns.

The last frustration is that their reporting can be wonky, and when you really pin down Rollworks for details, they can't explain the discrepancies. One example is that in a playbook, there may be twice as many Accounts Reached as Accounts Targeted. Who are we reaching, then, if they're not part of our Targets? We've been waiting for an answer to that question for 10 weeks. Another example is that an account will appear as 'not targeted' in a trending account report, but show that it's included in a specific account targeting playbook. Between the absence of leads and the inconsistencies in reporting, I've lost faith that our ads are even being seen by our targets.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks isn't solving any problems or providing any benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: A powerful ABM platform for air-cover and intent
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
We've had good results so far from integrating HubSpot with rollworks, syncing intent data and spikes, and creating multi-touch campaigns based on those spiking accounts. The ability to sync lists directly from HubSpot, and to reference values when building out target lists, has been fantastic. We also have Rollworks integrated with G2, so the intent data from G2 contributes to spiking account notifications, and is available to the team from the normal widget window inside of the linked accounts. The campaign management section is one that we haven't fully built to the point we want it, but the tools there to progress contacts and companies through different levels of engagment are great for providing air cover to sales teams, and to differentiate display retargeting messaging based on the lists themselves (and what segment the contacts may be in based on their list membership.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The biggest thing for us is limited sales insights seats. More are available with a paid subscription, but spending additional budget isn't an option there, or the additional spend would be better placed in expanding ad campaigns to our audiences.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks is more intelligently surfacing contacts and companies that have an interest in our market, but may not know about us specifically. Through that, it's giving us better indications of which companies we should be prospecting into and how we might be able to do that in a way that resonates with those users. It's also giving us the ability to follow relevant prospects around the web and keep our product top of mind. It's giving us the ability to more intelligently focus our messaging on the different market segments and the use cases that apply to them.

So far, so good! Our team collaborates with a wonderful RollWorks account manager, so whenever we have issues or questions, we do not feel left alone to figure them out ourselves.

When you are a young company, there are many things that you are building from the ground up and many instances where you need to pivot quickly and seamlessly. RollWorks allows us the opportunity to do that without straining internal resources.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks is easy to use and allows us to effectively target our ABM target accounts, and re-target website visitors with relevant display ads. Reporting in the platform is robust and allows us to slice and splice data the way we see fit. Our account manager is knowledgeable and works with us to achieve our objectives.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Integration with some other tools in our marketing tool stack is lacking. The ability to target based on additional demographics like job titles would be beneficial. Sometimes their ad frequency optimization doesn't work as we want it to. For example, sometimes, we see all our ads at once on a website instead of it being evenly spaced apart throughout the day.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform allows us to effectively target our ABM accounts and website visitors through the web on sites that they frequently visit to generate brand awareness and drive them back to our homepage to convert to a lead.

all_reviews.review_title: Very powerful account-based marketing tool with best-in-class support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The CSM & Account Management support we receive from Rollworks is truly second to none. They're responsive, proactive, and our team comes out of each meeting with a clear understanding of next steps, and how that translates to deliverables for them, and for us (Demand Gen & Marketing Ops). Thank you for all you do!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
At the platform level, I dislike very little - the user interface is very intuitive, and we can usually unpack new features fairly quickly. However, it would be nice to see expanded educational resources for individuals just starting out in the platform, or even uplevel more advanced Rollworks knowledge/skillsets.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks is one of the most powerful tools we have in our stack for paid ABM campaigns. And while we do have account-level ICP criteria to optimize spend in-house, Rollworks provides its own proprietary layer of ICP, best-fit targeting that helps ensure we are fully optimizing our paid efforts, particularly with Display. From a marketing operations perspective, the native integrations with Marketo and Salesforce (to name just a couple) are tremendously valuable and save us a lot of hassle.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks replaced our Digital Paid Ad Agency, Enabling us to ABM Target with Speed and Efficiency
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
What I find most helpful about RollWorks is the direct connection to our CRM (in this case Salesforce) providing us with real-time campaign creation against strategic named accounts (ABM). This replaced a cumbersome and inefficient system of relying on an outside media agency to book media buys and build targeted campaigns that were not connected to our prospect data.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
So far no major downsides to RollWorks. We've been live on the system for a little over a month as of this writing. The only improvement I'd like to see soon is adding additional advertising channels to the platform including Reddit, TikTok, etc.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
The primary business problem RollWorks helps us solve is marketing performance management for paid digital. With RollWorks, we're able to tell if we're spending efficiently and connecting with our strategic accounts. Not only for the marketing department visibility but our sales directors, using RollWorks Insights in Salesforce, see their account contacts engaging with our media buys and creating opportunities for sales engagement. This builds tremendous credibility for marketing effectiveness.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks is an easy-to-use platform to get started on Account-Based Marketing. They have the basics you need in an ABM strategy. Key integrations with Salesforce CRM and Marketo to execute different trigger events. The integrations are easy to setup and it helps to create different fields and values for reporting in Salesforce once integration is done. Navigating the RollWorks platform is easy and makes sense. They have a good Account Journey mapping feature and able to deanonymize website traffic. We were also able to access new attribution reporting tools and Rollworks recently rolled out their own intent data analytics which is a nice feature that uses 1st party data and intelligence Rollworks is able to gather from different data sources.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks relies heavily on integration to Salesforce and Marketo to trigger or orchestrate cross funnel Account Based Marketing plays. There's no native functionality within Rollworks to build out a workflow to orchestrate ABM plays that other ABM platforms offer. Any orchestration of ABM plays relies on the integration to Salesforce and updating fields or rules in Saleforce to trigger a direct mail, or sales follow-up in Salesforce. I'd like to have some sort of native orchestration to build complex campaigns that include all digital channels and engagement natively on the platform.

Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
Rollworks is a good stepping stone to dip your toes in Account-Based Platforms. If you're a big organization I'd expand your vendor review but the other platforms are more expensive. Rollworks is an affordable option to do the basics of ABM.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Account Based Marketing engagement and Account Mapping. We wanted to get more intelligent in how we target our accounts. Using intent data to go after the right accounts through 3rd party and first-party data. Being able to take these account lists and send them to different digital channels to advertise to. Our team also needed a way to look at the full account journey to see all the touch points an account makes to convert to an opportunity to figure out ways to replicate this.

all_reviews.review_title: Newly Onboarded and still feeling hopeful!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
When evaluating vendors, I looked for an ABM solution that had a strong background in ad delivery and performance and since Rollworks was built on the backbone of Adroll, their ad delivery is great!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
As great as the ad delivery is in the US, the performance in other regions, such as EMEA or APAC, is relatively low. I would have loved to see better delivery/match rates outside of the US though I know GDPR complicates things.

Additionally, there are a number of features in the platform that are interesting to look at visually, such as the account activity; however, there isn't a way to easily ingest that information at scale. There are also features such as the account spiking that I wish were represented numerically, but they are only represented by flame emojis. That is cool visually, but it is very hard to action it across hundreds of accounts.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is helping us with our ABM strategy and influencing our account intelligence. All of the information we get from Rollworks helps to influence which accounts we will target moving forward and lets us know what messaging resonates with which accounts/personas.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks helps you pick up what you're leaving on the table in digital marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
RollWorks has given us new sources of quality top of funnel traffic that we can use to convert to marketing qualified leads. In addition, the rich analytics give us actionable, data-driven insights to help optimize along the funnel. With RollWorks, our sales team is challenged to keep up with the flow of quality leads coming through - a nice problem to have. We are getting more informed, personalized conversations with prospects thanks to the magic of intent topics - an incredibly impactful feature.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The only thing would be a better integration with Hubspot. We rely on Hubspot for our CRM integration. It still works well with our current systems, but there are some "nice to have" features that are available for other platforms like Salesforce that we'd like to be able to have. Also, we have had some recent issues with trouble shooting issues and account support due to account manager changes. Senor management is working with us on a solution.

Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
Now that we have RollWorks implemented and churning out insights and leads, we don't know how we lived without out it before. Our implementation came in time for Q2, and we are now on track for record leads through the second half of the year.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the problem of getting consistent, quality traffic that fits with our ideal client profile. With RollWorks, we gain insight like never before into the best fit prospects for targeting and marketing. We used to have hit-or-miss ability to fill the funnel and difficulty tracking lead sources. RollWorks has opened up a whole new world of precision marketing through reaching our current target lists as well as discovering new potential accounts. Our management team is thrilled with the traction in less than three months.

all_reviews.review_title: Rollworks is a simple platform that gives amazing results
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks is a fantastic Account-Based Marketing option. It's a simple interface, with step by step setup and an incredible team to assist in setting up your account for success. I've worked with several clients who have had almost instant leads generated from this platform. One client closed a huge deal in less than two months after setting up Rollworks. Not only is it a simple marketing tool, but the Rollworks team will make sure that the sales side gets appropriate training to capitalize on the leads and turn account spikes or opportunities into customers. It's the perfect tool to marry your marketing and sales teams.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The only thing I think Rollworks could improve on is sharing more data on the ad. When running social media ads through the platform there were a few metrics that I felt like I was missing through Rollworks. It is also tough to optimize those social media ads.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Like I said in a previous response, Rollworks is the connection from marketing to sales. The platform allows marketers to create ads and run them through a simple setup, and once they are live, the sales team gets tons of information on who to reach out to, what to talk about, and jump in to warm and ready leads. It's an excellent tool for both sales and marketing.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
When I first started using RollWorks in 2020, the in-platform UX left a bit to be desired. However, RollWorks has improved their UI and ease of navigation tremendously since then - it's in a much better spot.

It's letting us serve intent-based campaigns to individuals who are already researching topics and services related to our business thanks to how easy it is to deploy intent data. It informs us how effective our campaigns are at an account level, making it easy for us to decide where to scale further.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing if not THE BEST ABM Platform, however lacking some features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
We have an amazing relationship with the vendor. Our teams have been so helpful in testing new strategies, offering suggestions on ways to improve, and supporting us when we need help troubleshooting. The capabilities of the platform are unmatched. There are deep integrations with 3rd party apps and all sorts of targeting options. All these options combined have helped us to strategize ways to execute omnichannel marketing out of one platform.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Some of the lacking features primarily surround the UI and reporting. The UI filters are useful but could be better. The filtering options are different depending on which part of the platform you are on. The reporting could do with some updating or improved API connections. Reporting lacks country-level insights, frequency insights, audience analysis insights, and limited views into inventory.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
The most important problem that the platform solves is providing insight into how and if marketing is affecting contacts, accounts, and opportunities against specific target account lists. It helps provide the much needed data in showing how marketing helps bring new users into the funnel, pulls opportunities down the pipeline, and grows the accounts.

Also, I love the ease of the way we can integrate with HubSpot so we can effortlessly ensure we are advertising to the same target accounts that our business development team is actively reaching out to.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Honestly, there's not much to dislike. Being newer to the platform, I am learning. I think it's a little more complicated than I initially thought, but that is due to having to learn a whole new platform. I'm very used to HubSpot, for example, so it's just taking a bit of time to get used to the nuances of Rollworks. That said, this is not a negative about Rollworks. It's just taking some time to learn the platform. It would be nice to have a way to export automated custom reports and email them to specified team members. Right now there is only a set list of reports that can be automatically exported at a set time.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
First, brand awareness. We're reaching more accounts in our ICP than ever before. Also, it's giving us intent data so we're able to help our new business team focus on more qualified accounts. In our past our target account lists weren't as strategic as they are now and that's thanks to the data we are receiving from Rollworks. I think it's helping our marketing and sales teams align much more than we ever had in the past and it keeps us focused based on data rather than assumptions.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
review_question_answers.answer: The reports and the ease of which you can export them is great. I'm able to share these insights with our business development team and ensure that we are taking some sort of action on them. Also, I love the ease of the way we can integrate with HubSpot so we can effortlessly ensure we are advertising to the same target accounts that our business development team is actively reaching out to.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Display/Programmatic Platform for the ABM Marketer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
RollWorks is a really easy-to-manage ad platform with a simple layout of playbooks (campaigns) and ad upload features. Little to no management on a day to day basis is needed, making it easy for strapped teams. Journey stages features allows you to identify how accounts are moving down the marketing funnel, further showing the value of RollWorks.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Limited reporting capabilities in the platform as far as playbook performance. Usually have to ask customer success rep for more in-depth reports, especially over time or broken out by country.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to target against our target account list, accounts in our Salesforce and Marketo, unlike other paid channels. Allows us to view how accounts are progressing down the marketing funnel due to our paid media and digital efforts.

In the beginning it looked promising but it all ended up with a frustration

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
So we were advertised the personalized (at least function/title) personalization for ABM campaigns within the product and the customer success team, after several weeks of figuring out the case said it wasn't possible. We spent 5 months not getting results at all but investing in the platform and marketing campaigns. Customer success team wasn't interested in our success.

It helped only with covering up general account targeting as a part of our ABM campaign, but it wasn't useful as the companies we were targeting were 1000+ people and we couldn't target specific roles/functions.

all_reviews.review_title: Director
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Provides many insights and website activity about my target accounts and contacts.  The Daily Spiking Accounts Reports and Website Activity is good.   We also get Lead Forensics and this info is often very similar to Lead Forensics without adding much extra.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks doesn't provide detailed information about who is accessing our site; presuming due to Privacy requirements.   I used to get Daily Spiking Accounts Report virtually every day, but I don't anymore.  I had submitted a ticket to Support and it took them a very long time to finally resolve it.    Even after it was "resolved", I don't get Daily alerts very often so it seems either there really aren't any alerts (which means this is not a great value) or there is and I'm not getting them (perhaps a sync problem).

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
It occasionally provides insights that is helpful.  However, often I see the data that Rollworks provides isn't very useful - I'm not sure if I just don't understand all the benefits of Rollworks, or it just isn't that beneficial.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Easy to use. The platform is very intricate, but with guidance from the Rollworks team, it becomes easy to use. The journey stages and playbooks are game-changers. Watching accounts move from unaware to converted has been so valuable! I also really enjoy the intent tool and have seen brands surging with intent fill out our forms soon after.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Not a true lead generation tool for my industry. I do not know if it's my industry or the tool specifically, but tracking the lifecycle of a lead is very cumbersome.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Brand awareness, awareness into what accounts or companies are currently researching our brand. Those two things have been technically "solved" by rollworks as a platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Data matching, scalability, and "same language" = a happy customer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Our match rate was very high when scoping out Rollworks compared to other options. Additionally, and not insignificantly, the platform pricing and UX/UI made it an easier sell to leadership. We're a fast growing start-up and are not looking to waste money on a platform that we can't quickly leverage or a platform that holds us into a long-term contract.

The "Same language" part of Rollworks has been instrumental in getting sales teams quickly bought into ABM and leveraging Rollworks data in their efforts. What I mean by "same language" is that terms and things used in the platform are terms that we would typically use in marketing and sales to describe things and is not a made-up language that only relates to the platform company it's on.

Lastly, and going back to the point about scalability, as one person managing all acquisition programs, I can spin up countless programs quickly to cover everything I need to.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Some of the integrations with Hubspot are not robust. We're moving to Marketo/Salesforce though so this will be less of a problem but having some of the reporting and dashboards that are in Rollworks, available to folks in the CRM would be really helpful to make sure folks are getting all the right information they need.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we're having is "everyone" is a potential customer for us, so how do you cut through the noise and find folks actively looking for you as a solution so you can accelerate sales wins and continue to build momentum and adoption for your company?

The LinkedIN API that allows us to reduce wasted spend within priority accounts.

Allowing precise targeting with very niche targeting

Although we are still in the early stages of adoption, the funnels they have set up in the platform are impressive. You can tell the people who set up the campaigns and platform know their stuff. Can't wait to see how our playbooks evolve as we get more insight from our campaigns.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?

RollWorks has been an answer to our need for account based marketing. As we are an enterprise B2B SaaS company, ABM is something that needed to be a part of our martech. There was an ABM service attached to our automation platform but it didn't even come close to the functionality of RollWorks.

all_reviews.review_title: Either Rollworks doesn't want us as a customer anymore, or our team needs have drastically changed
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The platform itself is reasonably easy to use, and Rollworks has a lot of self-help education available on its website. I especially like the intent feed. The data and insights are at the level of detail we need.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
We have been a Rollworks customer for a little over two years now. When we first started with the program, we were really pleased with it. I think a large part of our success was due to the account manager assigned to our account. She took the time to understand our business, what metrics and reporting were important for our leadership, and helped us find creative ways to utilize Rollworks. And then she got promoted - good for her but bad for us. We were reassigned to a new account team, and it has been a struggle - My team feels like we are speaking two different languages. The Rollworks account managers are good people who are following what Rollworks wants them to follow. . .but Rollworks way of supporting customers isn't working for us.

Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
A couple of things that will help you ensure the success of your RollWorks platform: 1. Have a strong understanding of Account-based advertising and marketing. This is not a beginner's tool. 2. Designate at least one team member to become a super-user. There can be a pretty significant time investment associated with administering this platform. 3. Understand that there is a lot to unpack in this tool and it may be above and beyond what your organization needs. I suspect you could hire a digital agency to outsource ABM & advertising for a comparable cost.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Utilizing the Rollworks platform provides us with a level of visibility and reporting on marketing-influenced revenue, a KPI important to our leadership. Rollworks can also help us identify potential new targets through its intent engine, which helps inform us on topics and trends we can focus on for our campaigns, content, etc.

all_reviews.review_content:

Rollworks has made it easy to engage with target accounts using display advertising, and its reporting functionality, both in-platform and inside Salesforce, is great for monitoring progress and refining your approach over time.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Certain actions that ought to be automatable require manual intervention. The interface, while improving, is still confusing at times - I often forget where a specific function or tool lives.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We want to be better able to not only understand which target accounts are ready for outreach, but to take active steps to help push accounts along to the point that they are ready. Rollworks helps on both counts.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I think the ease of using the platform to achieve measurable results has been one of the best aspects so far. We were new to ABM when we started using RollWorks to optimize and it's made creating and launching an ABM strategy a breeze. I have also had a really great time working with their account team! They're always very responsive, thorough, and knowledgeable. I really appreciate all of their online resources as well. I've used their education services and videos numerous times.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I've had some issues with the LinkedIn features, but their product team was super proactive in setting up a call to talk through my concerns and get feedback. I know LinkedIn is notorious for making integrations tricky, so this may also be a result of those restrictions.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving our brand awareness problems! As a smaller company with a new marketing team, RollWorks was a great way to quickly scale brand awareness across all of our target segments. It has also been a great resource to pass actionable engagement and intent data on to our Sales team.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent for display programs and air coverage for dynamic lists at scale
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I really like the ability to integrate with our CRM and MAP to get dynamic target lists. It allows us to set aside different air coverage streams for different segments based on custom account fields and segmentations, making it really versatile to create awareness, nurture, etc. I also like the ability to place dynamic text in our ads.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I don't like that they have a base spend requirement as a way to decrease the software cost. That made it cost-prohibitive for us when our spend threshold was lower, even though we really could have used a tool like RollWorks. It's also not great that they don't have support for LinkedIn Lead Gen ads. That would have made it a clear winner over other ABM platforms, whereas currently it's clear strength is display.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Display for dynamic segments at scale. We can plan out what kinds of ads we want to show to accounts depending on what stage they are in their lifecycle, and have that automatically set based on preconfigured audience rules.

all_reviews.review_title: Reasonably strong platform for ad management, some room for improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
- Centralized ad library to easily see all ads, their status, and some bulk editing capabilities
- Query engine to create account lists based on third-party or Salesforce properties
- Can manage display ads and social ads in one central location
- Ability to create lists of specific Salesforce contacts with low minimum size.
- Excellent / attentive CSM and support.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
- Interface can be confusing as can the overall product concept hierarchy - e.g., some lists are created in SFDC, some inside the RW UI. I do believe this is being improved or is on the roadmap for improvement.
- Biggest limitation from my point of view is lack of full support for all ad types on social platforms. Last time I checked you could not create most types of ads on LinkedIn for example, so I had to control those in the LinkedIn interface. If the selling point is having a single place to manage everything, being comprehensive is very important.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Providing a centralized interface for managing all display advertising for demand generation and ABM. The centralized library is useful to see all ads in the same place and it's quite easy to launch new campaigns.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
The only downside I have seen so far is that while much of the data is current within 24 hours, a few stats are only current within 2-3 days. It would be helpful if all data could be just a little more timely. However, this has not prevented me from getting the information I need as I need it.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
The RollWorks platform is giving us a line of sight into our Target Accounts that we would not have been able to get without them. With their pricepoint, we're able to not only get targeted advertising and website activity insights, but also intent data, which is a huge plus.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid ABM platform, strong customer focus, great segmentation and reporting.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Rollworks is a pretty solid ABM/ad delivery platform when layering additional types of targeting such as intent targeting, industry targeting, etc. on top of your own list of desired accounts.  The team and process at Rollworks is very structured and they place a high value on ensuring that we are consistnetly improving and optimizing our campaigns, and have a wide variety of ways to assess success.  Our ad KPIs have also performed very well.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
While our ads have performed well, we haven't received a lot of conversions - some of this is based on the ad formats we're using and our own messaging, but I would find it beneficial in the future for Rollworks to develop their own gated landing page solutions.  In addition, due some compliance issues and their data policy, integration with our CRM is a bit difficult to achieve in accordance with our own data policies and standards.  In some cases, we would like more targeting capabilities (by industry, title) as well.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks is helping us re-engage accounts that have not been as active as we would like, and we have the ability to nurture them with a variety of content through a simple sales journey.  We've been able to show ways that these accounts are are interested and non interested in our products and services.

all_reviews.review_title: Very intuitive Retargeting & ABX platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Love how easy the system is to use. Ease often comes with a loss of capability, but not in the case of Rollworks. Ease with Rollworks comes in the form of a UI that has been thoughtfully created. The ability to dig into and manage your campaigns at a granular level is fully supported -- audiences, accounts, ads, campaigns, etc just a couple of clicks deep into the interface.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I'd like to see a deeper integration into their third party providers. For example, with LinkedIn, you can only manage standard ads through the RW interface. I'd like to be able to run video ads or even messaging ads -- that way I'm not having to bounce between multiple interfaces.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks, in my research and experience, is providing us the best account-based targeting platform in the category. Most of the systems out there for ABX are bloated, or have priced themselves into the stratosphere under the guise of being a 1-stop shop full service ad agency. For those of us who are capable of managing our own programs, Rollworks is the gold standard.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy and smooth ABM Platform for B2B
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I appreciate how simple it is to set up and launch campaigns. You can be sure you're targeting the proper folks with an accurate algorithm. I really like how I can check on spending and efficacy on a regular basis and make any required adjustments. Customer service is really helpful, and you don't feel trapped in a campaign that isn't performing as well as you had anticipated; modifications can always be made.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
With its integration and the various advertising alternatives available to be offered through LinkedIn, I feel Rollworks has space to improve. It would also be amazing if they could include retargeting on LinkedIn in addition to display ads. Unfortunately, they don't yet have their 3rd party intent data available to share through their sales insights integration in Salesforce.

Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
RollWorks is a great solution for companies looking to start an ABM strategy on a budget. Their functionality is great, and while it is not as robust as other programmatic tools, it is a great improvement to any marketing tech stack.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
I currently work with a B2B firm and RollWorks helps me keep track of all the campaigns we run. Through its Dashboard insights, it's easy to download reports and switch to different campaigns to run a quick comparison.

review_question_answers.answer: I appreciate how simple it is to set up and launch campaigns. You can be sure you're targeting the proper folks with an accurate algorithm. I really like how I can check on spending and efficacy on a regular basis and make any required adjustments. Customer service is really helpful, and you don't feel trapped in a campaign that isn't performing as well as you had anticipated; modifications can always be made.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
review_question_answers.answer: With its integration and the various advertising alternatives available to be offered through LinkedIn, I feel Rollworks has space to improve. It would also be amazing if they could include retargeting on LinkedIn in addition to display ads. Unfortunately, they don't yet have their 3rd party intent data available to share through their sales insights integration in Salesforce.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
review_question_answers.answer: RollWorks is a great solution for companies looking to start an ABM strategy on a budget. Their functionality is great, and while it is not as robust as other programmatic tools, it is a great improvement to any marketing tech stack.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I currently work with a B2B firm and RollWorks helps me keep track of all the campaigns we run. Through its Dashboard insights, it's easy to download reports and switch to different campaigns to run a quick comparison.

all_reviews.review_title: The Best ABM Platform for B2B
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
There is a lot to love about the Rollworks platform.

The platform is really easy to navigate, setting up campaigns is quick, the interface walks you through everything step by step. You have several options to drill down and review your data as well. You can setup detailed reports to run on a schedule and email you once a week/month/etc. on ad performance, conversions, impressions, etc. But what I really appreciate is the journey funnel view. This breaks down each target account list into three main categories: unaware, aware, engaged. Here you can get a quick glance at how many accounts are in each category. You can then drill down to see specific accounts and their activity on your website and their interactions with your ads. This is really helpful in knowing when to hand off a marketing lead to our SDR team.

If you have a CRM that integrates with Rollworks, like Hubspot, you can also see in the journey stage view which accounts have an open deal and a won deal.

But one of the best things about Rollworks isn't the platform, its' their account management team. If your on their standard plan or more you get a designated accoutn manager that sets up a meeting candence to review performance, brainstorm changes, and they help pull more indepth reporting. As a very small marketing team, this has been invaluable!

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Honestly, there really isn't much to dislike. Rollworks is fantastic about asking their customers what features they'd like to see and it seems about every 6 months they have new updates to roll out.

The only downfall is that you can only have one set of intent topics, and for a company that has several services with very different intent signals, this means we can only have one campaign setup with intent topics at a time.

Recommendations to others considering RollWorks Account-Based Platform:
Have a good understanding of the ABM program you want to run before purchasing any software, this will help you with your onboarding and setting up proper goals to measure success.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks has helped us target new accounts and start building brand awareness with a wider audience, but they also help us nurture sales prospects through the sales pipeline. We have a long sales process, so being able to show case study/testimonial ads to those prospects throughout their sales journey has helped reduce leads that go quiet.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible ABM with Powerful Integrations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Good integrations with Salesforce and G2 help us target the right accounts in the right stage of their buying journey. Their ABM playbooks also offer a powerful way to orchestrate end-to-end account-based campaigns. Lastly, I like that contact-based retargeting is rolled into the platform, as it allows us to run more inbound-focused campaigns and playbooks as needed (some other ABM platforms I've looked at only offer account-based targeting/reporting).

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
Sometimes new features are rolled out and don't offer the data/insight/functionality we want upon initial release. But our CSM is responsive to our feedback and has made changes we've requested in the past.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
Rollworks enables us to target the right accounts/contacts in the right stage of their buying journey. It is especially good and finding the right influencers and decision-makers in our target accounts using intent signals from Bombora and G2.

all_reviews.review_title: RollWorks experiences over the years
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
To set the stage, I used RollWorks back in 2018 in a previous role when it was just AdRoll before they had any ABM capabilities, and now I'm using RollWorks for ABM advertising at my current role. I do really like the ABM capabilities and being able to set up playbooks so that different sets of ads show up when an account is unaware vs aware. Being able to integrate with Hubspot is great and they just rolled out a new feature for HS integrations where sales can get email updates on "hot accounts".

Customer service has gone through its ups and downs over the years but I have a really great CSM now with biweekly calls.

What do you dislike about RollWorks Account-Based Platform?
I wish the job title targeting for ads could get even more granular. I also wish the playbooks had more functionality beyond unaware to aware (although there are ways you can hack it) but on the plan that we're on we only get limited playbooks so we have to pick and choose. It would be nice if personalized ads came with the standard/starter packages.

What problems is RollWorks Account-Based Platform solving and how is that benefiting you?
RollWorks is helping us drive awareness toward our target accounts and helping us spend our advertising budget more wisely (targeted not spray and pray). Leveraging the platform, we've been able to reach our target accounts in a new channel with relevant ads.
